Watch again: Draghi on adjusting monetary policy https://t.co/2K8v2Hj8Rr
Watch again: Draghi on the changed political outlook https://t.co/bqTylogreU

Letter Danièle Nouy, Chair Supervisory Board, to Mr Sven Giegold, MEP, on the staffing of joint supervisory teams https://t.co/YuhupsMqbb
Starting now - #ECBForum panel on innovation, investment and productivity. Follow live https://t.co/4LXrqmpS2E https://t.co/PLn5NteMPn
Session 1 of the #ECB Forum continues. Follow live coverage here https://t.co/4LXrqmpS2E https://t.co/idJooPhtWK
Session 1 of the #ECB Forum is starting now with discussion of first paper. Follow live coverage here https://t.co/de56Ejdrc2 https://t.co/an290sxr5H
Draghi: Any adjustments to our stance have to be made gradually & only when improving dynamics that justify them appear sufficiently secure
Draghi: So amid global uncertainties there are strong grounds for prudence in adjustment of monetary policy parameters
Draghi: But financing conditions are also determined by other market prices. Market volatility has at times caused unwarranted tightening
Draghi: The central bank can accompany recovery by adjusting parameters of policy, not to tighten stance, but to keep it broadly unchanged.
Draghi: As the economy recovers a constant policy stance will become more accommodative.
Draghi: Inflation dynamics are not yet durable and self-sustaining. So our monetary policy needs to be persistent.
Draghi on how the changed political outlook in the EU affects confidence and investment #ECBForum https://t.co/TRrbBgfgWK
Draghi: The threat of deflation is gone and reflationary forces are at play
Draghi: ECB analysis finds that low past inflation dragged down wage growth by around 0.25 percentage points each year 2014-2016
Draghi: Build-up of reflationary pressures slowed by external price shocks, more labour market slack & changing slack/inflation relationship
Draghi: Oil-related base effects are main driver of considerable volatility in headline inflation we have seen & will be seeing in euro area
Draghi: Between 2016-2019 we estimate that our monetary policy will have lifted inflation by 1.7 percentage points, cumulatively
Draghi: Since January 2015 and the announcement of the expanded asset purchase programme euro area GDP has grown by 3.6%
Draghi: Our policy needs to be persistent and we need to be prudent in how we adjust its parameters to improving financial conditions
Draghi: We can be confident that our policy is working and its full effects on inflation will gradually materialise
Speech Mario Draghi: Accompanying the economic recovery https://t.co/FBD9RY76M6
